metadata.title: CVE-2020-15969 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
Use after free in WebRTC in Google Chrome prior to 86.0.4240.75 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2020-15969` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 82.0.2+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 82.0.2+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 82.0.2+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.note: amurray> The Debian chromium source package is called chromium-browser in Ubuntu mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 19.10, the chromium-browser package is just a script that installs the Chromium snap tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '82.0.2+build1-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1').
